item.title: Get another taste of the Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds official soundtrack
item.content:encoded:
A new video highlights music inspired by Sonic Unleashed, Sonic Colours, and Sonic Adventure 2.

Sonic the Hedgehog isn't loved by everyone, but most people can agree that the music in his games is generally top-tier stuff. We expect the soundtrack to the upcoming Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds will be stellar, and Sega has released a brand new video that highlights six of the tunes in the game.

The video below, which runs for almost eight minutes, features a mix of six remixed tracks from CrossWorlds put together by Kanon Oguni!. These tracks from the official soundtrack are said to be inspired by courses in the game based on Sonic Unleashed, Sonic Colors, and Sonic Adventure 2.

About the music:

Apotos

  • Composed by Tomoya Ohtani
  • Arranged by @GigaVideos

Dragon Road

  • Composed by Kenichi Tokoi
  • Arranged by @Cametek.CamelliaOfficial

Galactic Parade

  • Composed by Tomoya Ohtani
  • Arranged by @torienaofficial

Market Street

  • Composed by Tomoya Ohtani
  • Arranged by @TeeLopes

Sweet Mountain

  • Composed by Kenichi Tokoi
  • Arranged by @nanobii

Radical Highway

  • Composed by Jun Senoue
  • Arranged by @djzardonic & Jun Senoue

Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds will release digitally and physically on September 25, 2025, and is available for pre-order now for PlayStation 5 (PS5), PlayStation 4 (PS4), Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and PC starting at £64.99.

Physical and digital pre-orders for Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch- OLED Model, and Nintendo Switch Lite are available now starting at £54.99. The Nintendo Switch 2 system version will be available for pre-order at a later date starting at £64.99 for the Standard Edition and £79.99 for the Digital Deluxe Edition. There will be a paid upgrade path available for owners of Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch- OLED Model, and Nintendo Switch Lite, with content and progress able to carry over through the upgrade. The Nintendo Switch 2 system version will launch digitally this holiday 2025 and physically early 2026.

item.title: Emergency Call 112 - The Firefighting Simulation 3 revealed for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series consoles
item.content:encoded:
The new game aims to be even more authentic, developed in cooperation with the Mülheim an der Ruhr fire department.

If you simply can't get enough authentic firefighting video games, publisher Aerosoft has got some great news: Emergency Call 112 - The Firefighting Simulation 3 is coming to PC, PS5, and Xbox Series consoles, and is in development at crenetic.

The PC version is set to arrive first, initially in Early Access, with Aerosoft saying that the full release will be moulded by "community driven development." Versions of The Firefighting Simulation 3 will land on PS5 and Xbox after the game's full PC release.

About Emergency Call 112 - The Firefighting Simulation 3

"With Emergency Call 3, we’re building a new emergency simulation that reflects the daily rhythm of life at a fire station, every drill, every task, and every operation is part of a larger, continuous system where preparation is as important as the emergency itself. As we continue to work hard on development, we hope that fans of the series and new budding firefighters alike will find the game enjoyable and educational!" - said the team at crenetic.

Key Features:

  • Developed alongside Real Fire Fighters: Developed with the Mülheim an der Ruhr Fire Department to ensure accurate procedures and operations.
  • Interactive Character Progression: Track and improve physical and professional attributes through training and mission experience.
  • Specialized Roles & Qualifications: Earn operational roles like attack squad, hose team, or driver/operator through targeted courses and drills.
  • Open Game World: Multiple urban districts with varied missions, from firefighting to traffic accidents.
  • Dynamic Shifts: Full day-night cycle, changing weather conditions, and a rotating duty schedule.
  • Detailed Fire Station Simulation: Perform daily tasks and interact with an explorable fire station environment.
  • Missions with Real Stakes: Plan and execute operations to protect lives and property, with performance evaluations after each shift.
  • Powered by Unreal Engine 5: Delivering high-fidelity visuals, lighting, and environmental realism.

item.title: Neo Berlin 2087 - Gamescom 2025 Gameplay Trailer shows off impressive visuals
item.content:encoded:
Futuristic action-RPG is coming to PS5, Xbox Series consoles, and PC.

Elysium Game Studio has released a brand-new gameplay trailer for its third- and first-person action RPG, Neo Berlin 2087. According to the developer's official website, the game is coming to PS5, Xbox Series consoles, and PC.

The game first appeared in a pre-alpha footage gameplay trailer two years ago, and also made an appearance at Gamescom last year. Elias Toufexis, known as the voice of Adam Jensen in Deus Ex: Human Revolution, and as Seraphim in Netflix's Blood of Zeus, announced last year that he'd signed on to play the main character.

As the name suggests, this is a futuristic world, and the trailer looks pretty impressive.

From the trailer blurb:

Dive into the dystopian cyberpunk world of Neo Berlin 2087 – a unique third- and first-person action RPG crafted for fans of immersive single-player experiences. Uncover a deep, narrative-driven story through never-before-seen gameplay, new levels, cinematic cutscenes, and intense combat. Meet new characters Bryan and Phoenix in this action-packed Gamescom 2025 reveal.
